text.p: Blue-chip stocks ended on a strong note Friday, regaining the previous session's steep losses as the August jobs numbers eased Wall Street's worst fears about a sharp rise in interest rates by the Federal Reserve.

Based on early and unofficial data, the Dow Jones industrial average ended up 52.90 points at 5,659.86, bouncing back from Thursday's 50-point fall. In the broader market, advancing issues led declines 16-6 on moderate volume of 350 million shares on the New York Stock Exchange.
